text: Hi, I have an hyperledger project running on my VMs with a chaincode deployed on it. This chaincode updates the world state in its invoke method. Now I'd need to query a previous world state... Does anyone know if it can be achieved ?
<@U2TUCLGRJ>: you might ask in the project channel, <#C0Y4PEU22|fabric> or <#C16GB844D|sawtooth> as appropriate
<@U0UHG4VP1> <#C0Y4PEU22|fabric>
<@U2TUCLGRJ>: yes, ask your question there
<@U0UHG4VP1>: all baseimage-release jobs failing for reasons that arent clear: <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/>
any insight?
seems to be having trouble with git clone, I assume its related to the git-parameter/tag stuff, but its not clear what is failing
<@U0KPFAZNF> I believe Ry is at the NYC hackfest
The git clone failures appear to be misconfiguration with git credentials.
I just touched down
<@U1BC5NF2S> <@U0UHG4VP1>: ty
Ah, I should have looked at your schedule closer. :slightly_smiling_face:
I haven't changed anything
<@U0KPFAZNF> How pressing is this issue? Are you blocked on publishing a release to the community? Forgive me for missing some of the context, just trying to prioritize.
Does this need resolved in the next two hours or so?
I was planning on lunch
its blocking the release of the new baseimage v0.2.2 to the community, but I am not under the impression it cant wait X hours
ill defer to the P/Z folks: <@U0YK3KKCY> <@U11NUTP4L> any comments ^^^
it would be nice to get the new image out there
today sometime
take lunch!
food is good. :slightly_smiling_face:
Ok. I can look later, unless <@U1BC5NF2S> has a burning desire to look.
tnx!
In a middle of a meeting, so no. :wink:
:+1::skin-tone-2::+1::skin-tone-2::+1::skin-tone-2:
<@U0UHG4VP1> Enjoy your lunch, and glad you got there safe!
Thanks!
:knife_fork_plate:   <@U0UHG4VP1>
:pizza: :beers:
<@U0KPFAZNF> fabric-baseimage-release-docker-* right? do I care about vagrant?
<@U0KPFAZNF> the job fails because the ref is invalid
we dont care about -vagrant right now, we disabled that in the pipeline
i have to build it by hand
<@U0UHG4VP1>: not sure what you mean by the ref is invalid
I did this (which is a lightly edited version of the console log from one of the jobs):
<@U0UHG4VP1|ry> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ry/F3CLEH06T/-.txt|Untitled>

text: ah, yes, i see what you mean
could someone review the output of: <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/job/fabric-baseimage-release-docker-x86_64/5/>
and review the output of: <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/job/fabric-baseimage-release-docker-s390x/3/>
and insure that the right thing ended up on dockerhub?

text: <@U0KPFAZNF> ^^^
from inspection of the log it looks like v0.2.2 was checked out, built, and pushed to x86_64 and s390x platforms
cool
I'll retrigger ppc64le and see if the failure was something timing related
it wont go live until the coresponding  update is pushed to fabric, so that gives the P team a chance to investigate
OK
in the meantime, I need to either manually build vagrant v0.2.2 or push a CR that basically decouples the devenv from baseimage
what can I do to help?
just getting the ppc build producing the content is great for now
<@U0KPFAZNF> <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/job/fabric-baseimage-release-docker-ppc64le/5/>
it looks like they all got pushed here: was that your design? <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage/tags/>
or should they have landed here: <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage-s390x/tags/> and <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage-ppc64le/tags/> ?
That's correct
We should probably remove those other repos until such a time they will be used
<@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0UHG4VP1> thanks very much pushing 0.2.2 base images out! :clap:
just got back from one of my mandatory xmas parties. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0YK3KKCY> you should be able to test locally by editing fabric.git/.baseimage-release
checked docker hub and... voila
ok
I have a little more prepwork to do before I can commit that, but theres no harm in testing locally
ok. let me test that out.
s390x-0.2.2: Pulling from hyperledger/fabric-baseimage.... good sign. ha
